data.title: Wearable Devices announces pricing of $3.3M direct offering
data.description:
• Wearable Devices (WLDS) said on Thursday that it has entered into a securities purchase agreement with an existing single institutional investor for the purchase and sale of 1.23M ordinary shares at a purchase price of $2.67 per share in a registered direct offering. 
  • The gross proceeds from the offering are expected to be approximately $3.3M. 
  • In addition, in a concurrent private placement, Wearable Devices will issue and sell unregistered warrants to purchase up to 1.23M ordinary shares. The warrants will have an exercise price of $2.67 per share. 
  • Wearable Devices (WLDS) shares were down 0.46% in pre-market trading.

data.title: Cullen/Frost Bankers GAAP EPS of $2.67 beats by $0.28, revenue of $567.2M beats by $3.45M
data.description:
• Cullen/Frost Bankers press release (CFR): Q3 GAAP EPS of $2.67 beats by $0.28.
  • Revenue of $567.2M (+5.3% Y/Y) beats by $3.45M.

data.title: Monumental Energy announces private placement offering of 10M-15M units
data.description:
• Monumental Energy (MNRG:CA) (MNMRF) intends to complete a non-brokered private placement of 10M-15M units at $0.05/unit for gross proceeds of a minimum of $500,000 and a maximum of up to $750,000.
  • Each unit will consist of one common share and one transferable common share purchase warrant.
  • Each warrant will entitle the holder to acquire one additional common share at a price of $0.08/share for a period of three years from the closing date of the Private Placement.
  • The company intends to use the net proceeds to fund the costs and expenses to formally enter into and fund additional workover projects with New Zealand Energy and L&M Energy, additional expenses at Copper Moki-1 and for general working capital purposes and corporate expenses.

data.title: Janus Henderson declares $0.40 dividend
data.description:
• Janus Henderson (JHG) declares $0.40/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 3.62%
  • Payable Nov. 26; for shareholders of record Nov. 10; ex-div Nov. 10.
  • See JHG Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: GlobalFoundries, Silicon Labs expand partnership to accelerate wireless connectivity solutions
data.description:
• GlobalFoundries (GFS) and Silicon Labs (SLAB) announced on Thursday the expansion of their strategic partnership to advance the development of next-generation, energy-efficient wireless technologies.
  • As a part of the partnership, Silicon Labs wireless system-on-chips (SoCs) will be manufactured on GlobalFoundries’s new 40nm Ultra Low Power platform. 
  • The company said the collaboration aims to accelerate the development and production of high-performance wireless solutions manufactured at GlobalFoundries’s advanced facility in Malta, New York.
  • Development is underway, with production ramping over the next several years, it added. 
  • “We’re excited to deepen our strong partnership with GlobalFoundries to accelerate U.S.-based innovation in wireless connectivity,” said Matt Johnson, President and CEO, Silicon Labs. “This collaboration underscores our shared commitment to innovation and U.S. manufacturing leadership – addressing rising demand for our Series 2 products and strengthening global supply chain resilience to deliver competitive, secure and scalable wireless solutions for our customers.”
  • SLAB +1.13% premarket to $133.83.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: BlackLine gains as activist Engaged Capital pushes for sale process
data.description:
BlackLine (BL) rose 4% in premarket trading as activist Engaged Capital is pushing the software company to explore a potential sale. 

The push comes after a Bloomberg report on Monday that SAP (SAP)  made an offer for  Blackline in the high $60's/share earlier this year, a bid that was rejected by the company,

"As a large stockholder, we were disappointed (but unfortunately not surprised) to learn that BlackLine’s Board of Directors (the “Board”) simply rejected SAP’s offer,"  Engaged Capital Founder and CIO Glenn Welling wrote in a letter to the board on Thursday. "This is especially concerning given the Company has failed to create any stockholder value in recent years and has dramatically underperformed relevant software indices over all relevant time periods."

Engaged Capital warned that if the company does not pursue a path to a potential sale the investor is "prepared to hold the Board accountable at the upcoming annual meeting; a path we hope will prove unnecessary," Welling added.

data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Medical Properties Trust misses Q3 revenue estimate; FFO in-line
Stock index futures fall as Meta, Microsoft results leave investors unimpressed
data.description:
Stock index futures fell on Thursday, as investors were left unimpressed by Meta (META) and Microsoft (MSFT) results. Traders were now geared up for Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) earnings and assessed the latest updates of the U.S.-China trade talks.

S&P 500 futures (SPX) -0.2%, Nasdaq 100 futures (US100:IND) -0.3%, and Dow futures (INDU) -0.3%.

U.S. President Donald Trump announced a one-year agreement with China covering rare earths and critical minerals, while also halving fentanyl-related tariffs on Beijing (from 20% to 10%), effective immediately, following his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday.

"The U.S. (though not yet China) announced a year-long Sino-U.S. trade agreement. The details have to be worked out. Markets are likely to be cheered, but not wildly enthusiastic," UBS' Paul Donovan said. 

Traders and investors watched markets end the day mixed on Wednesday after the FOMC announced a 25-basis-point rate cut.

The Fed reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%-4.00%, its second straight cut, as it seeks to ease off the brakes in an effort to protect the labor market.

"On rates policy, our economists maintain a baseline of a 25 bps rate cut in December but see the hawkish-leaning signal as consistent with their view of fundamentals pointing to fewer rate cuts than priced by markets," Deutsche Bank's Jim Reid said. 

"The Fed spoke with an almost British accent yesterday, cutting rates a quarter point with a Bank of England-like three-way vote split. Fed Chair Jerome Powell signaled that a December cut was not inevitable," Donovan said.

Wednesday also saw a slew of tech companies report their earnings, namely Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOG)(GOOGL) and Meta (META). 

Meta Platforms (META) was down 7.1% in a premarket trade as it recorded a one-time income tax charge of nearly $16B and also raised its full-year guidance for total expenses.

Class A shares (GOOGL) of Alphabet rose 6.7%, while class C shares (GOOG) also added 6.7% premarket as the firm delivered its first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue, while its AI assistant Gemini app hit over 650M monthly active users.

Microsoft (MSFT) was down 3.1% even after it topped quarterly expectations, though its investments in ChatGPT developer OpenAI hit its profit.

"Then after the market close, we saw results from Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet send contrasting signals on the payoffs from the AI investment boom. The three tech giants saw their joint capex bill rise 89% Y/Y to $78B in the latest quarter," Reid said.

In the day ahead, traders will get more tech earnings, with Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) set to report after the closing bell.

data.title: Hansa Biopharma GAAP EPS of -SEK1.75, revenue of SEK 30.8M
data.description:
• Hansa Biopharma press release (HNSBF): Q3 GAAP EPS of -SEK 1.75.
  • Revenue of SEK 30.8M (-36.8% Y/Y).
  • Year to date IDEFIRIX product sales totalled 143.6 MSEK and represented an increase of 29.1 MSEK or 25.4% compared to the same period a year ago (114.5 MSEK).
  • Year to date product sales represent approximately 102% of total full-year product sales achieved in 2024.
  • Product sales in the third quarter of 2025 totalled 30.1 MSEK, compared to 39.8 MSEK for the same period in 2024.

data.title: Mastercard in Charts: Worldwide GDV and Transactions up ~10% Y/Y in Q3, while Cross-border volume jumps 19%
